page.title: 01Dymchurch Domesday to 1985
page.content: Dymchurch is a village on the South- East coast snuggling between the sea- wall & Romney Marsh.It has a popula- tion of approx.5000.It is a popular tourist resort because of its sandy beaches,amusements,historic buildings & the light railway.The Domesday Book refers to Eastbridge where there was once a village that had 2 churches & 2 salt-houses.In Eastbridge Road by Chapel Cottage Farm & by Chapel Farm are the remains of the 2 churches. Domesday says that the village of Bur- marsh dates before 1066.Dymchurch has no harbour but there is a slipway for launching small boats.Romney Marsh is mainly farmland.Local History mentions smuggling in C18 & C19.The fictional rector-smuggler,Dr Syn,is remembered every August Bank Holiday when money is raised for local clubs at The Day of Syn fete.
